medical_history.chief_complaint: Symptomatic atrial fibrillation refractory to medical therapy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Paroxysmal palpitations once to twice per week with associated light-headedness and chest pain, ongoing for an unspecified duration. Initial pulmonary vein isolation performed 6 months prior had not resulted in cessation of atrial fibrillation despite medical therapy.
medical_history.family_history: One brother experienced a stroke at the age of 57 years.
